attributes.action: Extend the discharge period for bankruptcy to a minimum of  3 years.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Under the Enterprise Act (2002), since 1 April 2004, a bankruptcy in England typically lasts no longer than 12 months.  Previously the discharge period would be typically 2-3 years.
This change has resulted in individual bankruptcies reaching record levels. In many cases bankruptcy is seen as an easy way out of debt. The more lenient penalty does little to deter people from borrowing beyond their means and talking responsibility for their own finances.

rejection.details: Your petition has already been posted http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/backrupt/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
